intro: Anthericum pygmaeum, commonly known as the dwarf lily of the valley, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, bell-shaped white flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces berries that are dark blue when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Anthericum pygmaeum is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
